decks.notes: The deck revolves around using a combination of instant reanimation spells and powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Griselbrand, and Superior Spider-Man to quickly bring out threats and overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to quickly fill up the graveyard and bring back key creatures for a tempo advantage. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize helps control the opponent's game plan while setting up the combo. Overall, the deck focuses on fast and explosive plays to dominate the game.

This deck focuses on using powerful instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat big creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield quickly. It also utilizes cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate to dig through the deck and protect key combo pieces. With a mix of disruption like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and instant-speed interactions. The deck's key strategy is to surprise the opponent with explosive plays and outvalue them with card advantage.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing a combination of disruptive creatures and spells. It focuses on controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phalia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Solitude to deal with threats. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck looks to outmaneuver opponents and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also utilizes cards like Rest in Peace and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt graveyard interactions and card draw. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides an additional source of value and synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting the opponent's plans and outlasting them in the late game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths while controlling the board with removal spells like Kozilek's Command. The deck also utilizes mana-efficient lands like Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to cast its powerful creatures ahead of schedule, giving it a strong tempo advantage in the early game.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using instant spells like Goryo's Vengeance, Ephemerate, and Faithful Mending. By using cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Quantum Riddler to manipulate the top of the library, the deck can set up explosive plays and outmaneuver opponents. The inclusion of counterspells like Force of Negation and removal like Prismatic Ending helps to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to win the game by leveraging its graveyard and instant-speed tricks to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive tactics while disrupting the opponent's tempo and resources. It combines efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury with disruptive spells like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. By applying pressure early on and disrupting the opponent's game plan, it aims to close out games quickly. The deck also includes cards like Solitude for removal and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker for card advantage. The versatile land base helps ensure mana consistency for the deck's aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on generating large amounts of mana quickly through ritual effects and card draw spells in order to chain together spells and create a storm of damaging spells with Ral, Monsoon Mage. The deck aims to set up a powerful combo turn where spells are cast to deal high amounts of damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck includes ways to recycle spells from the graveyard and manipulate the top of the library to ensure consistent access to combo pieces.

This deck focuses on using low-cost spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent while also disrupting their game plan. It utilizes powerful cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Consign to Memory to put pressure on the opponent, while also using spells like Spell Snare and Prismatic Ending to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate to provide additional value and tempo advantage. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and disruptive, punishing the opponent for their plays while setting up for its own powerful combos.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco. These creatures are supported by cards like Lightning Bolt, Nulldrifter, Consign to Memory, and Doorkeeper Thrull to control the board and deal damage quickly. The deck also utilizes Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to protect its creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is built around fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent color access for the multicolored creatures and spells in the deck.

Utilizing artifact creatures and artifacts that can be sacrificed for various effects, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive approach. By using cards like Arcbound Ravager and Mox Opal to generate mana and power up creatures, the deck can quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. With the ability to manipulate artifacts and disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory.

The Jeskai Control deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counter spells, and powerful threats. By using a variety of instant speed spells and strategically deploying powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually gaining incremental advantage. This deck also includes efficient removal options like Prismatic Ending and Solitude, as well as powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and secure victory through careful resource management and precise decision-making.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter allows for repeated use of key instants like Counterspell and Orim's Chant. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant position and win through incremental advantage and inevitability. The land base is optimized for consistent mana production to support the control strategy.

This Aggro - Affinity deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Mox Opal and Spirebluff Canal enable fast mana ramp, while Urza's Saga helps tutor for specific cards. Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke provide removal and control options, while Thoughtcast and Thought Monitor offer card draw power. By utilizing a combination of artifacts, creatures, and spells, this deck aims to create a fast-paced and aggressive strategy that puts pressure on the opponent early in the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing cycling creatures and spells to control the board and fill the graveyard, ultimately casting Living End to bring back all creatures from the graveyard and potentially overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence. The deck also includes cards that disrupt the opponent's strategies and protect its own game plan, while also including various lands to support the deck's mana base and provide additional utility. The goal is to set up the perfect opportunity to cast Living End and swing the game in its favor.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures while also disrupting their game plan with burn spells. By utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage quickly, along with Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to take out threats, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and often. The inclusion of cards like Mutagenic Growth and Slickshot Show-Off allows for additional damage and versatility, making it a potent Aggro deck in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.
